body.p:
Danville Ky Sept 18. 1865
To His Excellency
Gov Bramblett

Your petitioner would state that some eight or ten years since he was indighted by the Grand Jury of Lincoln County at the time in session, for the offence of Carrying concealed weapons, and a jury of the County afterward found him guilty, and the fine is now ^(outstanding)^ against him in the hands of the Sheriff of Boyle County, and will by him be collected without the interposition of the executive clemency which he now asks for -- He states that he was not in the State at the time the witness or process shows, or purports to show that it was executed -- that he was not in the state to make defence at the trial of the Case, and judgment went against him by default, upon ^(a)^ wrong return of process -- He hopes that you will stay proceedings in the case and for the by an act of clemency which he thinks should be exercised and hopes will be

ever praying he is
very Respectfully
J, H, Goode

We the undersigned petitioners would respectfully state that we are well acquainted Jos H Goode and believe the foregoing statement made by said Good to be true
and hope that Your Excellency will find to compart with your duty and judgment to grant him the favor he asks at your hands --

We are very respectfully
your friends &c

B H Foly
Thos W. Varnon
J M Hocker
K. P. Jacobs
W C Lueas
Wellington Harlan
Sam P. Barbee

Lincoln Cir Ct
vs
Remit
J H. Goode
$50,
concealed weapon
20 Sept/65
